name: Commit Process
description: All Git commits must be executed through the `dspy_commit` module to ensure consistency, safety, and proper agent attribution.
path_to_scripting: This rule is implemented by always routing Git commit requests through the `dspy_commit` module (located in `configuration/modules/dspy_modules/dspy_commit.json`). When the agent needs to perform a commit, it would invoke this module, passing the commit message as an input. The `dspy_commit` module would then handle the actual Git commit operation, ensuring that all the necessary checks (e.g., identity verification, secret scanning) are performed before the commit is finalized.
